intro: Solanum monanthum, commonly known as the single-flower nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or violet, with a single flower per node, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans but may be consumed by certain wildlife. Solanum monanthum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
